title: 109_hr2747
content: The Act titled "Disabled Veterans Life Insurance Enhancement Act of 2005" aims to reduce premiums under the Service-Disabled Veterans Insurance Program. Section 1922(a) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to grant insurance under the same terms as National Service Life Insurance, with the amount set at $50,000 or a lesser divisible amount chosen by the insured. Premium rates are based on the Commissioners 1941 Standard Ordinary Table of Mortality and 2\1/4\ percent interest per year. Premium rates for policies issued before the enactment of the Disabled Veterans Life Insurance Enhancement Act of 2005 are based on the Commissioners 1941 Standard Ordinary Table of Mortality and 2\1/4\ percent interest per year. Policies issued after that date are based on the 2001 Commissioners Standard Ordinary Table of Mortality and 4\1/2\ percent interest per year. Insurance granted under this section shall be nonparticipating, with premiums and collections credited to a Treasury fund for direct payments. Appropriations to the fund are authorized, and waivers of premiums may be granted for insurance issued under this section. Waivers of premiums for insurance issued under this section shall not be denied based on the timing of total disability. Increase to $200,000 in maximum coverage under Veterans' Mortgage Life Insurance Program. Increase in maximum coverage under Veterans' Mortgage Life Insurance Program to $200,000. Amendments made to section 2106 of title 38, United States Code, including coverage limit and veteran's option to elect lower coverage. Amendments to section 2106 of title 38, United States Code include increasing maximum coverage to $200,000 and allowing veterans to elect lower coverage. Effective date for amendments is 120 days after enactment of the Act. The Servicemembers Group Life Insurance Program now includes coverage for still-born children from 20 weeks gestational age, effective November 1, 2001.
